ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who, ignoring the Reality, engage in pleasantries.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and amuse themselves with vain argumentation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and who indulged in false disputes against (God's revelations).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Those who are playing in pursuits.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those who were, in their falsehood, playing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Those who sport entering into vain discourses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Who play in talk of grave matters;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: who divert themselves with idle chatter:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Those who in wading sport themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —those who play around in vain talk,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: those who are in plunging, playing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:12] those who play around in vain talk, [in] falsehood, that is to say, those who are busily engaged with their disbelief;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Who play in talk of grave matters) who engage in falsehood;
